name: Modules.BLE.RegionManager
summary: An object that manages and scan beacons.

events.name: didEnterRegion
events.summary: Invoked when the user enters a monitored region.

properties.name: region
properties.summary: Beacon region object

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: didExitRegion
events.summary: Invoked when the user exits a monitored region

properties.name: cancelBubble

properties.name: type

events.name: didRangeBeacons
events.summary: Invoked when a new set of beacons are available in the specified region
events.description: If beacons is empty, it may be assumed no beacons that match the specified region are nearby. Similarly if a specific beacon no longer appears in beacons, it may be assumed the beacon is no longer received by the device.

properties.summary: Beacon region object

properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: didRange
events.summary: Invoked when a new set of beacons are available in the specified Beacon Identity Constraint
events.description: If beacons is empty, it may be assumed no beacons that match the specified Beacon Identity Constraint are nearby. Similarly if a specific beacon no longer appears in beacons, it may be assumed the beacon is no longer received by the device.

events.summary: Invoked when the authorization status changes for this application.

methods.name: requestAlwaysAuthorization
methods.summary: When locationManagerAuthorizationStatus == LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_NOT_DETERMINED, calling this method will start the process of requesting "LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_ALWAYS" authorization from the user.
methods.description:
An application which currently has "LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_WHEN_IN_USE" authorization and has never before requested "LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_ALWAYS" authorization may use this method to request "LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_ALWAYS" authorization one time only. Note: To call this method, you must have both NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription and NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription keys in your appâ€™s tiapp.xml file.

<key>NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription</key>
<string>Allow Location permission</string>
<key>NSLocationAlwaysUsageDescription</key>
<string>Allow Location permission</string>

For More Info: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/corelocation/cllocationmanager/1620551-requestalwaysauthorization

methods.name: requestRegionState
methods.summary: Asynchronously retrieve the cached state of the specified region. The state is returned to the "didDetermineState" event

methods.name: requestWhenInUseAuthorization
methods.summary: When locationManagerAuthorizationStatus == LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_NOT_DETERMINED, calling this method will trigger a prompt to request "LOCATION_MANAGER_AUTHORIZATION_STATUS_AUTHORIZED_WHEN_IN_USE" authorization from the user.
methods.description:
Note: This method runs asynchronously and prompts the user to grant permission to the app to use location services. The user prompt contains the text from the NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription key in your tiapp.xml file, and the presence of that key is required when calling this method. The user prompt displays the following options, which determine the authorization your app can receive.

<key>NSLocationWhenInUseUsageDescription</key>
<string>Allow Location permission</string>

methods.name: startRangingBeaconsInRegion
methods.summary: Start calculating ranges for beacons in the specified region.

methods.name: startRangingBeaconsSatisfyingIdentityConstraint
methods.summary: Start calculating ranges for beacons in the specified region.

methods.name: startRegionMonitoring
methods.description: If a region of the same type with the same identifier is already being monitored for this application, it will be removed from monitoring. For circular regions, the region monitoring service will prioritize regions by their size, favoring smaller regions over larger regions. Note: This is done asynchronously and may not be immediately reflected in monitoredRegions.

methods.name: stopRangingBeaconsInRegion
methods.summary: Stop calculating ranges for the specified region.

methods.name: stopRangingBeaconsSatisfyingIdentityConstraint
methods.summary: Stop an earlier beacon ranging request. See startRangingBeaconsSatisfyingIdentityConstraint:.

methods.name: stopRegionMonitoring
methods.description: It is valid to call stopMonitoring for a region that was registered for monitoring with a different region manager object, during this or previous launches of your application. Note: This is done asynchronously and may not be immediately reflected in monitoredRegions.

properties.name: isMonitoringAvailable
properties.summary: Determines whether the device supports monitoring for the specified type of region.
properties.description: If false, all attempts to monitor the specified type of region will fail.

properties.name: isRangingAvailable
properties.summary: Determines whether the device supports ranging.
properties.description: If false, all attempts to range beacons will fail.

properties.name: locationManagerAuthorizationStatus
properties.summary: Returns the current authorization status of the calling application.

properties.name: locationServicesEnabled
properties.summary: Determines whether the user has location services enabled.
properties.description: If false, and you proceed to call other CoreLocation API, user will be prompted with the warning dialog. You may want to check this property and use location services only when explicitly requested by the user.

properties.name: maximumRegionMonitoringDistance
properties.summary: The maximum region size, in terms of a distance from a central point, that the framework can support.
properties.description: Attempts to register a region larger than this will generate a kCLErrorRegionMonitoringFailure. This value may vary based on the hardware features of the device, as well as on dynamically changing resource constraints.

properties.name: monitoredRegions
properties.summary: Retrieve a set of objects for the regions that are currently being monitored.
properties.description: If manager has been instructed to monitor a region, during this or previous launches of your application, it will be present in this set.

properties.name: rangedBeaconConstraints
properties.summary: Retrieve a set of beacon constraints for which this location manager is actively providing ranging.

properties.name: rangedRegions
properties.summary: Retrieve a set of objects representing the regions for which this location manager is actively providing ranging.
